availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John E. Winn (Greenup County, Kentucky, justice of the peace)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, saddler, hotelkeeper, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy S. Kouns Winn. Father of Elizabeth Winn, Harriett L. Winn, John W. Winn, Edward H. Winn, Kate J. Winn, and Sallie M. Winn. Saddler in Greenup County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Greenup County in 1850. Hotelkeeper in Greenup County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Greenup County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 2, p. 157A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 2, p. 238.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, East Little Sandy Subdistrict 2, p. 836.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, East Little Sandy Subdistrict 2, p. 81A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, Greenupsburg, p. 38A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #1118.
"John E. Winn (1819-1904)," Find A Grave, Memorial #186336724, accessed January 10, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/186336724.
